fr.ign.cogit.geoxygene.style.colorimetry

Class ColorimetricColor

  • Object
    • ColorimetricColor

  • public class ColorimetricColor
extends Object
    The ColorimetricColor class represent a color by different colorimetric systems. It aims to deal with the RGB, CIELab, CIEXYZ, Java and COGIT reference systems. TODO : synchroniser les paramètres de couleurs! Modifier la teinte devrait également modifier les codes RVB par exemple !!
    Author:
    Charlotte Hoarau, Elodie Buard

    • Field Detail

      • idColor

        protected int idColor
        Color identifier in the COGIT reference system.

      • hue

        protected String hue
        Common hue of the colors of a ColorSlice. It is expressed in French. For example BLEU

      • lightness

        protected int lightness
        Lightness level of the color. It range from 1 to 7. All the levels does not exist for all the slices.

      • usualName

        protected String usualName
        Usual name of the color. It is made up of the hue of the corresponding ColorSlice and a literal transcription of the lightness level. It is expressed in French. For example: BLEU TRES FONCE

      • cleCoul

        protected String cleCoul
        Key of the color in the COGIT Reference System. It is an other identifier of the color. It is made up of the initial of the hue of the corresponding ColorSlice and the lightness level of the color ranged from 1 to 7. For example: B6 for BLEU FONCE

      • redRGB

        protected int redRGB
        Red component in the RGB color system. It range from 0 to 255.

      • greenRGB

        protected int greenRGB
        Green component in the RGB color system. It range from 0 to 255.

      • blueRGB

        protected int blueRGB
        Blue component in the RGB color system. It range from 0 to 255.

      • xScreen

        protected int xScreen
        The X Coordinate of the center of this color on the COGITColorChooserPanel.

      • yScreen

        protected int yScreen
        The Y Coordinate of the center of this color on the COGITColorChooserPanel.

      • ColorimetricColor

        public ColorimetricColor(int r,
                         int g,
                         int b,
                         boolean reference)
        Constructor with the RGB color component The boolean specify if the color must be in the COGIT Color Reference System.
        Parameters:
        r - The Red component in the RGB color system.
        g - The Green component in the RGB color system.
        b - The Blue component in the RGB color system.
        reference - true if the color must be in the COGIT Color Reference System, false else.

      • ColorimetricColor

        public ColorimetricColor(Color c)
        Constructor with a java color
        Parameters:
        c - Java Color

      • ColorimetricColor

        public ColorimetricColor(Color c,
                         boolean reference)
        Constructor with a java color. The boolean specify if the color must be in the COGIT Color Reference System.
        Parameters:
        c - Java Color.
        reference - true if the color must be in the COGIT Color Reference System, false else.

      • ColorimetricColor

        public ColorimetricColor(float l,
                         float a,
                         float b)
        Constructor with the CIELab component. FIXME Warning ! This constructor must be use with an existence test if the existence is not sure!! FRENCH : Cette méthode doit s'utiliser avec des tests si on n'est pas sûrs de l'existance d'une couleur!! TODO : Create a unit testing method to give an exemple
        Parameters:

      • f

        public static float f(float t)
        Colorimetric function of the CIE 1976 Lab color space. Used to calculate the CIE 1976 Lab color space components from CIEXYZ components.
        Parameters:
        t - a CIEXYZ component.
        Returns:
        The result of the function

      • labExistance

        public static boolean labExistance(float l,
                                   float a,
                                   float b)
        This method test if this CIELab coordinates describe an existing color.
        Parameters:
        l - The lightness in the CIELab color reference system.
        a - First chromatic component in the CIELab color reference system.
        b - Second chromatic component in the CIELab color reference system.
        Returns:
        True if the color exists, false otherwise. FIXME This method should be tested once again.

      • distanceCIElab

        public static float distanceCIElab(ColorimetricColor c1,
                                   ColorimetricColor c2)
        Calculate an euclidien distance between 2 colors in the CIE 1976 color space. Ie is usually called "deltaE" and refers to the total color difference.
        Parameters:
        c1 - First ColorimetricColor.
        c2 - Second ColorimetricColor.
        Returns:
        the distance between 2 colors in the CIE 1976 color space.

      • distanceRVB

        public static float distanceRVB(ColorimetricColor c1,
                                ColorimetricColor c2)
        Calculate an euclidien distance between 2 colors in the RGB color space.
        Parameters:
        c1 - First ColorimetricColor.
        c2 - Second ColorimetricColor.
        Returns:
        the distance between 2 colors in the RGB color space.
